---
title: Quotes
author: Marie-Hélène Burle
---

::: {.cell hash='quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_38c8ba104d98b4905d2a7375e3e6c233'}

:::


:::{.def}



:::

Let's experiment with quotes:


::: {.cell hash='quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_c02427e053672ba50012a51f402c70a1'}

```{.bash .cell-code}
variable=This string is the value of the variable
echo $variable
```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
bash: line 1: string: command not found
```
:::
:::


Oops...


::: {.cell hash='quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_396ea5e72e9652c717a3a44b44e62391'}

```{.bash .cell-code}
variable="This string is the value of the variable"
echo $variable
```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
This string is the value of the variable
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_88c0a09d0e1aff5c9960a498014d75b4'}

```{.bash .cell-code}
variable='This string is the value of the variable'
echo $variable
```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
This string is the value of the variable
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_2320067e982eb8812e4d33fb15288274'}

```{.bash .cell-code}
variable='This string's the value of the variable'
echo $variable
```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
bash: -c: line 1: unexpected EOF while looking for matching `''
bash: -c: line 3: syntax error: unexpected end of file
```
:::
:::


Oops...

One solution to this is to use double quotes:


::: {.cell hash='quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_99a24225034311c786a935a366530e4e'}

```{.bash .cell-code}
variable="This string's the value of the variable"
echo $variable
```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
This string's the value of the variable
```
:::
:::


Alternatively, single quotes can be escaped:


::: {.cell hash='quotes_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_425a90310c7ebe5d52e5b6592875c7e4'}

```{.bash .cell-code}
variable='This string'"'"'s the value of the variable'
echo $variable
```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
This string's the value of the variable
```
:::
:::


:::{.note}

Admittedly, this last one is a little crazy. It is the way to escape single quotes in single-quoted strings.

The first `'` ends the first string, both `"` create a double-quoted string with `'` (escaped) in it, then the last `'` starts the second string.

Escaping double quotes is a lot easier and simply requires `\"`.

:::
